alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 7:09PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Chama Near Chamita affecting Rio Arriba County. Rio Ojo Caliente Below La Madera affecting Rio Arriba County. Los Pinos River at Ortiz affecting Rio Arriba County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will keep river flows high. Expect minor flooding, including areas downstream from the Abiquiu dam. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Specific forecasts are not available for this location. However, snowmelt is expected to cause the river to rise and fluctuate near or slightly above flood stage. * WHERE...LOS PINOS RIVER at Ortiz. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flood waters will begin to inundate agricultural lands near the gage. Minor flooding along portions of Los Pinos Access Road will be possible. Low water crossings will become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM MDT Friday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.0 feet on 05/21/1973. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning around 1000 AM MDT.
